Fields.DialogueText: Morgana sighting, Captain.
Alert the crew.
@BATTLE
You're pushing yourself again, Fieramosca. What's the issue?
Everyone takes too long! By the time I hear our officers spot a Morgana, I'm already taking damage!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure that's entirely true. Are you not telling me something?
If it's such an issue, I can talk to the crew and sort everything out...
Blaming others? I thought we talked about this.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you calling me a liar, Capitano? You know I do everything I can for the safety of the vessel!
No... they won't understand.
But it is their fault! They want to replace me with a cuter French Belle!
I've seen you in a lot of moods, but this is completely new.
I'm just looking out for myself. You understand that.
I guess I can.
Good! Now promise that I'll never be split up with you!
Excuse me?
Make sure we stay together... okay?
Uh... okay?
Yes, Captain.
The Belle, too.
... Yes, Captain.
Do not even think of saying that!
I-I'm s-sorry, ma'am! I didn't mean anything by it!
Is that Fieramosca?
P-please forgive me! I'll never think of saying something like that ever again!

Fields.MenuText: What's the meaning of this? Are you causing trouble, Fieramosca?
I just want some peace and quiet every now and then. Is that too much to ask?
Both of you have ten seconds to explain what's going on.

Fields.DialogueText: Not as much as this loudmouth! He thinks that he knows everything about me!
Believe me, Capitano, I want it too! But when someone bad-mouths you, I have to fight back!
Just a big-mouthed crew member that doesn't know the meaning of "Stai zitto!"
Now get out of here!
I'm sorry! Right away! I'll leave right now!
What was going on?
*ALARM*
Nothing! Let's do what we came to do!
@BATTLE
Captain, there's been--
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Finally... it hasn't been this quiet in a long time. I can enjoy some--
I have to apologize, Captain! I'm sorry to disturb you!
So much for some relaxation.
It's about some of the harsh words that the Belle and I exchanged!

Fields.MenuText: I'm not sure I remember. What was the argument about?
Can you make this quick?
I don't even know what you two were yelling about.

Fields.DialogueText: Fieramosca didn't tell you? It was about you and her.
I'm sorry for saying awful things about the two of you! Please forgive me!
R-Really? I said something about you that set her off.
What did you say to her?
I asked you a question. Are you listening to me?
I said that you two never would have a chance...
A chance?
Save it. It's life or death!
It'll never happen again!
What's going on all of a sudden?
We need to focus on upgrading everything that I have!
Fieramosca... that's a tad expensive.
We need better individuals that know how to patch me up quickly!
Are you listening to me?
And we need to start throwing people overboard that can't keep up!

Fields.MenuText: We have to talk about the situation that happened a while back.
I can tell you're ignoring me. We have to talk about your shouting match eventually.
Hello? Fieramosca? Listen to me! The conversation with the crew member, what was it about?

Fields.DialogueText: Very well, Capitano. Se insisti.
Capitano! I'll tell you when people start paying attention to me!
It was... well... It is complicated.
Hear that? The alarm! Let's get this over with!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
That's what I've been trying to do...
Multiple sightings of Morganas in the area, Captain.
Alert the crew, and tell Fieramosca that we need her up here.
@BATTLE
He insulted me.
Pardon? How's that?
"I don't know who you think you are, but you'll never be with the Captain. You'll be decommissioned eventually."
What did he mean by that?
The idiot meant that I'm not good enough. That I'm a failure.

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't matter what the crew thinks of you. As long as I say so, you're one of us.
It only means that? Nothing else? You seemed pretty upset.
Prove to them that you're tough. You always do.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Capitano. Now, can I throw anyone who bad-mouths me out into the sea?
It only meant that! I promise! Don't get any ideas!
I can only do so much...
Are you sure that there's nothing else you'd like to talk about?
What?! No! Shut up!
Ahem... I'll let you get back to that after-action report, shall I?
If you wouldn't mind.
The Morganas are going to feel my full fury today.
@BATTLE
You were pretty intense during that last fight.
So? Do you have an issue with that?
I don't... but it seemed like you tuned everything out around you.
I have to do something to block out everything. I don't have time to put up with the crew.

Fields.MenuText: You've never had an issue like that change your demeanor in combat before. Why is it an issue now?
I need you to be aware of your surroundings, Fieramosca. You should know that every second counts against the Morganas.
Are you tuning me out as well?

Fields.DialogueText: I refuse to let them think that I've failed you, Capitano. I'm going to prove to them how tough of a Belle I am.
You think I've forgotten about things like that? I don't care what it takes, but those Morganas go down no matter the cost.
You're the only one that I pay attention to.
Just... be careful, Fieramosca. I don't want you to get too damaged.
You're the only person that's ever said that...
You're looking... determined.
Really?
... Never mind! Forget I said anything.
I'm looking forward to that.
Not that it's different from every day.
Of course not.
You know, Fieramosca... I never got the chance to hear your history.
Never came up. Why do you want to know? Looking to get rid of me?
Of course not!
It was a joke, Capitano. Anyway... I'm not sure where to start.
Must be an honor to be given such a name.
Sure, it's great. Nothing I love more than trying to live up to a legacy. The constant berating, the mechanical failures... it's a real morale booster.
There you go again...
What? Got a problem?

Fields.MenuText: No, quite the opposite. I didn't know you had a sense of humor. I always took you for the no-nonsense type.
I do. I don't remember you having this much sarcasm. I think you're starting to grow on me... maybe even warming to the crew?
Depends... How much sass are you going to give me? I'm just curious about you, Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... maybe you're paying attention. A little bit more than you usually do.
Shut up! You wish! No way do I like any of the crew! I t-tolerate you... but that's it!
I'm just being careful. Last thing I want is more reasons for you to replace me...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Looks like our number's been called. Ready?
I was built ready! Don't imply otherwise.
I was named after a true patriot. A nobleman and a condottiero of the highest order. Ettore Fieramosca.
Why are you getting so defensive!? It's just an observation! I'm not looking to scrap you!
You should know why! We don't need any of them!
What's going on?
This idiot thinks we need seaplanes to assist us! We don't need them! We've been doing fine without!
And I was just recommending it as a potential strategy. I didn't say it was going to happen!
He's lying! I can see it on his face! First they add new toys to "help" us. Next thing you know, I'm decommissioned and sent to a junkyard to be torn apart piece by piece!

Fields.MenuText: Both of you calm down! The last thing anyone needs is more tension! You're both in the wrong! Apologize!
If he was just discussing it, then he's not looking to replace you, Fieramosca. I promise.
What is the issue? We're at war. People talk and think of potential situations that could give us the upper hand. Nothing wrong with that.

Fields.DialogueText: Why should I? They've been nothing but trouble ever since we started working together! I hear them talk about me! I know the nickname you've given me!
Don't be too sure. He might come for you next, Capitano.
I can't believe this.
What set her off?
You didn't know? She was originally supposed to be able to carry seaplanes into battle. I thought if I brought it up... maybe she would realize that we just want to make her the best she can be.
I'll talk to her. I appreciate your reasoning. Just try to be a little less... reasonable.
*ALARM*
Go find her, won't you?
... Is that--
Yes, it's an order.
@BATTLE
We need to have a discussion. It's about what happened between you and a fellow officer.
I'm guessing you're not going to let it go.
I'm not. He told me about your history with seaplanes.
Here we go. Look, I was supposed to have a hangar installed in me. Just like... Surcouf.
The French submarine?
I don't need to be told every waking moment how inferior I am to her!

Fields.MenuText: The officer you argued with... he was just trying to help. He wanted to make you as strong as possible.
It doesn't matter whether or not Surcouf is better than you. I chose you. I wanted to be stationed with you, Fieramosca.
You're going to have to realize that we all care about you. Don't beat yourself up.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Great. Now I feel every bit the idiot he is.
You mean that? I-I guess... uh... thanks, Capitano.
I know who I'd like to beat up.
Are you okay, Fieramosca?
Yeah... I just... I'm sorry, Capitano.
It's okay, Fieramosca. You didn't do anything wrong. Now let's go get something to eat.
*ALARM*
... or not.
@BATTLE
Captain... do you have a moment?
*ALARM*
Hold that thought.
@BATTLE
Captain... do you have a moment now?
Sure. Is everything okay? You sound uneasy.
Well... remember the argument that Fieramosca and I were having?
Yes, what happened?
She... apologized to me.

Fields.MenuText: Fieramosca? Apologize? Is this your idea of a prank?
Are you sure it wasn't a dream?
I don't believe you. No way she would have done that.

Fields.DialogueText: I swear, Captain! It's not a prank! She actually talked with me and some of the crew about battle tactics!
I'm being honest, Captain! Whatever you said, it made her a bit friendlier towards all of us!
Fieramosca may be changing... maybe she's starting to trust all of us?
So why did you want to tell me this?
Because I know you talked to her.
You think I'm responsible for this?
You're the only one she listens to.
Capitano, there are Morganas approaching quickly.
We're ready for them!
@BATTLE
Fieramosca? Are you around?
I'm by your quarters.
There's some rumors about you. I think you should hear them.
No thanks. I'm not interested in hearing from a bunch of bullies.
I heard that you apologized to the officer?
Nobody can keep their mouth shut...
Fieramosca...
It's not a big deal! People should keep to themselves!

Fields.MenuText: It's nice to see that you're starting to trust the crew. I thought I'd never see that happen.
You're awfully cute when you get so embarrassed.
I just wanted to thank you. For being nice. They all respect you, Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: Why is it such a big deal!? It doesn't mean anything!
What?! N-no I'm not! Stop acting weird!
Please, leave me alone. This has nothing to do with me feeling bad! I still hate them!
That's all I wanted to say. Thanks again.
Grr... my skin's crawling now and it's all your fault...
What are you up to, Capitano?
Nothing. Do you need something?
No... I just... can I come in?
Sure. Make yourself at home. Is everything okay, Fieramosca? You look worn down.
Remember when we talked about how I came to be?
You mean your construction? I remember. What of it?
Well... It kind of felt... nice... talking about my construction.

Fields.MenuText: Are you actually opening up to me, Fieramosca? I'm impressed.
Fieramosca, you want to talk more? You don't need to...
Say no more. Tell me about yourself, Fieramosca.

Fields.DialogueText: I-I just think that you would trust me a bit more if I did! It's nothing personal!
But... I want to talk, Capitano...
Really? Ok...
So how is it that you were unable to carry seaplanes?
That's not too hard to guess. It didn't work. The cost alone...
Morganas!
Let's go!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Grazie a Cristo.
You're awfully close to me, Fieramosca. Can I eat my meal in peace?
No, Capitano.
You have a problem with that?

Fields.MenuText: Not really. You can get closer if you want. I don't bite.
Do I look like I have a problem with it?
Of course I do! Give me some space!

Fields.DialogueText: Say something like that again and I'll throw you into the ocean.
Hmm... not really. You actually look happy.
Too bad! You're stuck with me!
Why are you doing this? You obviously have a plan.
You need to stay in top form in order to lead correctly! Eat properly and you'll get there.
What?
I refuse to see you send me to my doom! You are going to be held accountable for me!
Uh...
If you mess up, I'll be there! The pressure is on you!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm actually feeling a little less pressure now...
Captain, that was almost a direct hit!
Fieramosca, stay sharp. The Morganas aren't playing around today.
@BATTLE
Is that the last of them?
Not picking up anything, Captain. We're all clear.
Damage?
I'm fine. You, on the other hand, need improvement!

Fields.MenuText: Excuse me? What do I need to work on? The fight went fine!
Are you criticizing me? Also, you're too close... again.
Do you want to be the captain? I won't stop you.

Fields.DialogueText: You were too indecisive! You could have damaged me! I could've been hurt!
I can get as close as I want! You need to get more creative in these fights! Do it for me! It's how we'll win!
No! You have to get better!
Why are you yelling at me? What's gotten into you?
You don't want me to get hurt, do you!?
Of course not! I want to do everything I can to protect you and the crew!
That's what I wanted to hear. You pass, Capitano. For now.
I'll show you sharp.
You're testing me, all right.
What was that!?
I said you're the best in all the fights!
Pull back, Fieramosca. That's an order!
Forced to be a coward... I'm going to need a shower after this.
@BATTLE
I've been wondering about something, Fieramosca.
What? I'm not apologizing for criticizing you in front of your crew!
It's not that.
Then what is it?
Why do you constantly try to ram into the Morganas? You always put yourself in danger.
Because creativity wins wars.
That's a lie. Why do you really resort to recklessness?
How else am I going to show my country how tough I am?

Fields.MenuText: Damaging yourself is how you show off? I don't get it.
Explain.
That doesn't make any sense, Fieramosca. What if you seriously get hurt?

Fields.DialogueText: When they were testing me, I was weaker than the others. They said that my weakness was the fact that I lacked endurance.
I was told that my awful endurance made me unsuitable for combat.
Then they spend money to repair me. For a Belle with "low" endurance, I excel at getting back up on my feet.
That's your way of proving yourself?
It is. You have a problem with that?
As long as it works.
Of course it works! I've got it down to a science!
You're science.
And don't you forget it!
The Morganas are retreating, Captain.
Pursue. Let's finish them off.
@BATTLE
Morganas eliminated. Although I think you've pushed a bit too hard, Fieramosca.
I'm fine. I always get back up, don't I?
How bad is it this time?
Are you indulging him? I'm fine! End of story!
Ramming yourself into the enemy hasn't been the most suitable move. You're starting to show wear and tear.
Meaning?
There's no telling when we could suffer a breach.

Fields.MenuText: Fieramosca, you need to take things easy. That's an order.
I think you'll need to change up your strategy.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. Only because you asked so nicely, Capitano...
Just until we're back in shape for this one, right?

Fields.MenuText: We can't keep this up. We're lucky you're still intact.

Fields.DialogueText: Luck's got nothing to do with it! We're here because I did everything right!
Look. Your strategy rates you a few days in port. Fresh paint, a resupply... all that good stuff. Imagine how hard you'll hit once you've had a good rest.
... With a strawberry sherbet frappe?
Chianti?
Mmm...
You're not eating, Fieramosca...
I'm supposed to be keeping you at top form, remember!?
Are you upset about your injuries from earlier? Is that why you're not eating?
You have to give me something to work with. I can't help if you're quiet.
Am I still... appealing?
What?
Answer the question.

Fields.MenuText: Yes... yes, Fieramosca. You're still "appealing."
If you're wondering whether or not I find you cute... I still do.
You can still fight. That's appealing to me.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad you think so, Capitano.
Um! Th-Thanks...
As long as I'm still useful to you, that's what matters most.
Now eat your food.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Have the galley keep it warm for me. I hit harder when I'm hungry!
Fieramosca, one second.
I've noticed that you've been a tad slower recently. Is everything okay?
Everything is fine. Leave me alone.

Fields.MenuText: You think I'm going to believe that? I know you're troubled.
Really? Well... I guess I'll head on back to my quarters. Sorry to bother you.
I'm not leaving until you tell me what's wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: You are too nosy, Capitano.
No...wait! I-I'll tell you...
Fine.
... Have you ever been in love?
Maybe, maybe not.
I care for someone. But I don't think they know.
Are they back home?
No, they're closer.
How close?
... Dangerously close! Hear that? It's the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Morganas to the west, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I wanted to thank you, Capitano. Dealing with me and my injuries... that port visit was nice.
You're a tough one. That's what I love about you. There's a reason I keep you around.
I'm joking...
You're the only one who'd have me.

Fields.MenuText: I know... and it was worth the risk. You may have flaws, but so does everyone else.
I knew your potential. I'm just that smart.
You're welcome.

Fields.DialogueText: That means a lot to me.
Okay, don't get too ahead of yourself!
Thank you.
I was almost left training others for Pola. I thought I'd do it forever... Until you took me with you.
I like you here. So does the Regia Marina, I reckon. So does the world.
Thank you, Capitano. Grazie.
Come get a face full of my hull, you harlots!
Ah. Hello, there.
Salve, Capitano.
... You know, I think I finally get it.

Fields.MenuText: That I'm a great leader? Glad to hear it!
What are you talking about now, Fieramosca?
Care to explain yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: Sei pazzo.
What? The all-knowing Capitano doesn't know what I'm talking about?
Sure.
I remember all the awful things I said about the crew.
I do too.
I remember all the yelling, pointing fingers...
What are you doing?
I wanted to say that you were right all along.
Fieramosca...
Shut up. Know that I feel safe with everyone here... because they're my team.
You've come a long way.
Well, naturally. I'm me.
Wouldn't have you any other way.
H-hey! What's that supposed to mean?
*ALARM*
No time to explain! Morganas, inbound!
Hey! Get back here!
@BATTLE
We've received reports of heavy Morgana sightings in the area.
Sound the alarm and remain alert.
@BATTLE
What is this? Where's the crew?
Remember a long time ago how you blamed your mistakes on lack of high-class food?
I do... I'm sorry that I--
So I decided, since you have matured, to reward you for your faith in us.
Are you saying...
Tonight, you eat like a queen. I got a bunch of imported, high-class cuisine.

Fields.MenuText: Well? Have anything you want to say?
I'm guessing your silence means that you're thankful?
Are you listening?

Fields.DialogueText: I-I love you.
I'm sorry, what?
Don't wait for me. Dig in!
Did I say that I love you?
High alert, Capitano. Let's do some drowning.
Capitano, there are Morganas nearby. What do you suggest?
Proceed with caution.
@BATTLE
You've been doing a great job at being careful, Fieramosca.
I haven't come this far to let a stupid mistake cost me the war.
While I think you've been doing great, maybe we should discuss how to keep up our winning streak.
What do you have in mind?

Fields.MenuText: I think we need to be more aware of our surroundings. You've done a great job being on the defensive, but we can't afford to be hit from behind.
You should get more aggressive.

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking that too. You know, we make a good team.
Well, I think we've been doing fine! But if you want to tempt me, I guess I won't stop you...
In any event, you should be on your guard. We're starting to get momentum and I don't want to lose you.
I don't want to lose you either, Capitano. I swear I never will.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe try some more defensive maneuvers. If we let the Morganas come to us, they'll never escape.

Fields.DialogueText: Ooh, I love it when you talk that way.
... How much caution?
It's a naval engagement, not a joust.
Tragedy of tragedies...
*ALARM*
Man your stations!
@BATTLE
Another group of Morganas down! Fieramosca, you did excellent out there!
Did I? Did we see the same battle?

Fields.MenuText: We did see the same fight. You were great.
Don't beat yourself up over nothing. The enemy has been defeated.
What is it now?

Fields.DialogueText: You obviously didn't notice what the issue was...
I think I need to say something. It's obvious that I wasn't in top form!
It's the fact that I'm getting sloppy!
I'm getting slower, Capitano!
No, you're not. You're on the defensive, remember?
But I couldn't react as quickly as I would have wanted to! I could put everyone in danger!
But you didn't.
Come again?
If you did badly, we would've been able to tell. You don't have to fear failure anymore, Fieramosca. You've proven yourself.
I... uh... thank you, Capitano.
You heard the capitano! Don't make me send you running for the Morganas!
Have you seen Fieramosca?
I haven't, Captain. She's not loitering near the crew's quarters?

Fields.MenuText: I would've heard from her by now. Usually she's by my side.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure she's fine...
When she's worried about something, she hides from us. Is Fieramosca damaged? Is she afraid of letting us down?
Everything's in good shape, Captain. Has she been acting strange lately?
A while back she mentioned something about love...
Love? Fieramosca?
Apparently she's fallen in love...
I think you should check your quarters when you get the chance.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Well, someone find her before the Morganas find us.

Fields.MenuText: I would have thought she'd be in the galley. She can't keep her appetite at bay forever.
She hasn't been outside?

Fields.DialogueText: She's been missing from there for a while. The cooks have been praying round the clock.
She hates it out there when we dive. I probably would too.
There you are! I've been looking all over for you! Is everything okay?
I love you.
What?
Do I need to repeat myself, Capitano? I've fallen for you.
Fieramosca...
You're the only one who never judged me. You protected me when I thought I was falling to pieces... or when I failed to see it.
You know what? I have something to tell you too.
What?
I have feelings for you too. You don't give up even when you're falling apart. Literally. You do great things. If you let me do great things for you... well, that's a pretty good deal.
Heh. Falling for a ship? You're an idiot...

Fields.MenuText: And you're beautiful.
And you're in love with one.
A captain goes down with--

Fields.DialogueText: D-don't finish that sentence!
Grr... you have your moments.
Heh... I'd say my design's been perfected!
So. What do we do with that?
... We feast like royalty. With strawberry sherbet frappes for dessert.
*ALARM*
But first we scour the Morganas from our vicinity! They're not invited.
Not even for frappes?
Maybe if we swap the chianti for thermite...
